lucaa - (02/04/2009 10:47): yes, you could think about applying for a less popular project if you have doubts things are going to sort out the way you want them. But you should not choose a project you don't like at all just because it's less popular  
lucaa - (02/04/2009 10:51): alexmaru: is your project proposal at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/XWikiWidgetandFirefoxextension inspired from this http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/XWikiCrossPlatformWebandDesktopWidget2009 ?

alexmaru - (02/04/2009 10:54): lucaa: nope

tudor\_f - (02/04/2009 13:27): hi, can anyone give me some brief details about XWiki's storage system? from what I've found it seems to be related to Java Content Repository  
sdumitriu - (02/04/2009 13:28): tudor\_f: Not exactly. We abstract the storage behind interfaces, with different implementations. We do have an experimental JCR storage engine, but the main storage is done with Hibernate on top of a RDBMS  
sdumitriu - (02/04/2009 13:29): You should look at http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-core/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/store/  
sdumitriu - (02/04/2009 13:29): (It's quite messy in there, we're working on refactoring this module)  
tudor\_f - (02/04/2009 13:30): thanks; mainly i'm interested on how i could improve the photo gallery's module storage system  
tudor\_f - (02/04/2009 13:31): from what i can tell until now, it's simply attachement based with a serialization in the back in a xml file..  
lucaa - (02/04/2009 13:33): tudor\_f: I think the serialization you're referring is done only on export. Otherwise it is stored in a database. But as sdumitriu said, through interfaces. So you should not take into account anything more but these interfaces, to guarantee you that all you'll do is usable regardless of the storage engine, I think  
sdumitriu - (02/04/2009 13:34): You should not think about this  
tudor\_f - (02/04/2009 13:34): yeah, i was wondering why the base64 encoding on the jpg files :)  
sdumitriu - (02/04/2009 13:34): The storage is a given, it is not your concern to improve it  
sdumitriu - (02/04/2009 13:35): It is bad, but fixing it is a different project  
sdumitriu - (02/04/2009 13:35): Which requires a lot of deep knowledge about XWiki  
tudor\_f - (02/04/2009 13:37): so i can focus on building a nice & clean user interface on the photo gallery, good to hear that :)  
tudor\_f - (02/04/2009 13:49): i've noticed that there's a Lightbox integration module already existing inside the code repository; does that mean there's a Prototype/jQuery/Ext/MooTools and such inclusion snippet somewhere out there?  
sdumitriu - (02/04/2009 13:54): The lightbox is not that clean  
sdumitriu - (02/04/2009 13:54): It's more of an ad-hoc hack  
sdumitriu - (02/04/2009 13:56): About JS frameworks, we're using Prototype. I think that it's the more serious of them (Prototype is to  JQuery like Java is to Visual Basic, IMO)  
tudor\_f - (02/04/2009 14:00): prototype will do fine (though i do manifest a preference towards jquery to be honest) :)
